intro: Meniscium guyanense, commonly known as the Guyana meniscium, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with a fern-like appearance and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
